item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Werewolf
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
yeah that’s especially a big requirement if it’s made to look like a hunter. (considering the real hunter sure as heck will CC you).

Also as by default there is in fact a unique class he can imitate, I’d say it’s almost a pretty bad idea to mimic hunter on the whole, just because you can mimic his ability doesn’t really prepare for the CC problem.

Oh and Namewise, as a pen and paper D&D player, and a dwarf fortress player… why we always gotta limit ourselves to wolves when making a lycanthrope. Why not a weregopher, or werebadger etc…

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Werewolf
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
The Werewolf

Neutral Killer

Passive (Ferocious) You are immune to death, occupation and target changing at night. While poisoned or bleeding, your attacks will bypass healing and death immunity.

Passive (Canine Sense) You will not attack players defended by a Knight or the Hunter if he bears.

Night Ability (Full Moon) - Attack two players. (1 day cooldown - Infinite uses)

Night Ability (Maul) - Bleed someone. They will die in one night if not healed. Generic notification shared with Hunter wolf. (2 uses)

Goal: Defeat the Blue Dragon, Unseen/Cult and any neutrals who seek to do you harm.
